list_definition.definition: (of people or animals) to (cause to) move on foot at a pace slower than running, never having both or all the feet off the ground at once

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He walked across the room and sat down
How long will it take to walk to the station?
She walks her dog in the park every morning.

list_definition.definition: to travel on foot for pleasure

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We’re going walking in the hills for our holidays.
It’s dangerous to walk the streets of the city alone after dark.

list_definition.definition: (the distance covered during) an outing or journey on foot

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She wants to go for / to take a walk
It’s a long walk to the station.

list_definition.definition: a way or manner of walking

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There are many pleasant walks in this area.
